00002 #
00003 #  Implements function calls
00004 #

00006 package Parser::Function;
00007 use strict; no strict "refs";
00008 our @ISA = qw(Parser::Item);
00009 
00010 $Parser::class->{Function} = 'Parser::Function';
00011 
00012 sub new {
00013   my $self = shift; my $class = ref($self) || $self;
00014   my $equation = shift; my $context = $equation->{context};
00015   my ($name,$params,$constant,$ref) = @_;
00016   my $def = $context->{functions}{$name};
00017   $name = $def->{alias}, $def = $context->{functions}{$name} if defined $def->{alias};
00018   my $fn = bless {
00019     name => $name, params => $params,
00020     def => $def, ref => $ref, equation => $equation,
00021   }, $def->{class};
00022   $fn->weaken;
00023   $fn->{isConstant} = $constant;
00024   $fn->_check;
00025   return $fn->Item("Value")->new($equation,[$fn->eval])
00026     if $constant && $context->flag('reduceConstantFunctions');
00027   $fn->{isConstant} = 0;
00028   return $fn;
00029 }

00033 #  (Implemented in sub-classes.)
00034 #
00035 sub _check {}

00039 #
00040 #  Evaluate all the arguments and then perform the function
00041 #
00042 sub eval {
00043   my $self = shift; my @params = ();
00044   foreach my $x (@{$self->{params}}) {push(@params,$x->eval)}
00045   my $result = eval {$self->_eval(@params)};
00046   return $result unless $@;
00047   $self->Error("Can't take %s of %s",$self->{name},join(',',@params));
00048 }
00049 #
00050 #  Stub for sub-classes
00051 #
00052 sub _eval {shift; return @_}
00053 
00054 #
00055 #  Reduce all the arguments and compute the function if they are
00056 #    all constant.
00057 #  Otherwise, let the sub-classes reduce it.
00058 #
00059 sub reduce {
00060   my $self = shift;
00061   my $constant = 1;
00062   foreach my $x (@{$self->{params}})
00063     {$x = $x->reduce; $constant = 0 unless $x->{isConstant}}
00064   return $self->Item("Value")->new($self->{equation},[$self->eval]) if $constant;
00065   $self->_reduce;
00066 }
00067 #
00068 #  Stub for sub-classes.
00069 #
00070 sub _reduce {shift}
00071 
00072 #
00073 #  Substitute in each argument.
00074 #
00075 sub substitute {
00076   my $self = shift;
00077   my @params = (); my $constant = 1;
00078   my $equation = $self->{equation}; my $context = $equation->{context};
00079   foreach my $x (@{$self->{params}})
00080     {$x = $x->substitute; $constant = 0 unless $x->{isConstant}}
00081   return $self->Item("Value")->new($equation,[$self->eval])
00082     if $constant && $context->flag('reduceConstantFunctions');
00083   $self->{isConstant} = 0;
00084   return $self;
00085 }
00086 
00087 #
00088 #  Copy the arguments as well as the function object
00089 #
00090 sub copy {
00091   my $self = shift; my $equation = shift;
00092   my $new = $self->SUPER::copy($equation);
00093   $new->{params} = [];
00094   foreach my $x (@{$self->{params}}) {push(@{$new->{params}},$x->copy($equation))}
00095   return $new;
00096 }
00097 
00098 #
00099 #  Create a new formula if the function's arguments are formulas
00100 #  Otherwise evaluate the function call.
00101 #
00102 #  (This is used to "overload" function calls so that they will
00103 #   work in Value.pm to produce formulas when called on formulas.)
00104 #
00105 sub call {
00106   my $self = shift; my $name = shift;
00107   my $context = Parser::Context->current;
00108   my $fn = $context->{functions}{$name};
00109   Value::Error("No definition for function '%s'",$name) unless defined($fn);
00110   my $isFormula = 0;
00111   foreach my $x (@_) {return $self->formula($name,@_) if Value::isFormula($x)}
00112   my $class = $fn->{class};
00113   my $result = eval {$class->_call($name,@_)};
00114   return $result unless $@;
00115   Value::Error($context->{error}{message}) if $context->{error}{message};
00116   Value::Error("Can't take %s of %s",$name,join(',',@_));
00117 }
00118 #
00119 #  Stub for sub-classes.
00120 #  (Default is return the argument)
00121 #
00122 sub _call {shift; shift; shift}
00123 
00124 #
00125 #  Create a formula that consists of a function call on the
00126 #    given arguments.  They are converted to formulas as well.
00127 #
00128 sub formula {
00129   my $self = shift; my $name = shift;
00130   my $formula = $self->Package("Formula")->blank($self->context);
00131   my @args = Value::toFormula($formula,@_);
00132   $formula->{tree} = $formula->Item("Function")->new($formula,$name,[@args]);
00133   return $formula;
00134 }

00141 #
00142 #  Check that the function has a single numeric argument
00143 #    and check if it is allowed to be complex.
00144 #
00145 sub checkNumeric {
00146   my $self = shift;
00147   return if ($self->checkArgCount(1));
00148   my $arg = $self->{params}->[0];
00149   if ($arg->isComplex) {
00150     if (!$self->{def}{nocomplex} || $self->context->flag("allowBadFunctionInputs"))
00151       {$self->{type} = $Value::Type{complex}}
00152     else
00153       {$self->Error("Function '%s' doesn't accept Complex inputs",$self->{name})}
00154   } elsif ($arg->isNumber || $self->context->flag("allowBadFunctionInputs")) {
00155     $self->{type} = $Value::Type{number};
00156   } else {$self->Error("The input for '%s' must be a number",$self->{name})}
00157 }
00158 
00159 #
00160 #  Error if the argument is not a single vector
00161 #
00162 sub checkVector {
00163   my $self = shift;
00164   return if ($self->checkArgCount(1));
00165   if ($self->{params}->[0]->type =~ m/Point|Vector/ || $self->context->flag("allowBadFunctionInputs")) {
00166     $self->{type} = $Value::Type{number};
00167   } else {$self->Error("Function '%s' requires a Vector input",$self->{name})}
00168 }
00169 
00170 #
00171 #  Error if the argument isn't a single complex number
00172 #    and return a real.
00173 #
00174 sub checkReal {
00175   my $self = shift;
00176   return if ($self->checkArgCount(1));
00177   if ($self->{params}->[0]->isNumber || $self->context->flag("allowBadFunctionInputs")) {
00178     $self->{type} = $Value::Type{number};
00179   } else {$self->Error("Function '%s' requires a Complex input",$self->{name})}
00180 }
00181 
00182 #
00183 #  Error if the argument isn't a singe complex number
00184 #    and return a complex.
00185 #
00186 sub checkComplex {
00187   my $self = shift;
00188   return if ($self->checkArgCount(1));
00189   if ($self->{params}->[0]->isNumber || $self->context->flag("allowBadFunctionInputs")) {
00190     $self->{type} = $Value::Type{complex};
00191   } else {$self->Error("Function '%s' requires a Complex input",$self->{name})}
00192 }

00199 #
00200 #  Check if the function's inverse can be written f^{-1}
00201 #
00202 sub checkInverse {
00203   my $equation = shift;
00204   my $fn = shift; my $op = shift; my $rop = shift;
00205   $op = $equation->{context}{operators}{$op->{name}};
00206   $fn = $equation->{context}{functions}{$fn->{name}};
00207   return ($fn->{inverse} && $op->{isInverse} && $rop->{value}->string eq "-1");
00208 }
00209 
00210 #
00211 #  Check that there are the right number of arguments
00212 #
00213 sub checkArgCount {
00214   my $self = shift; my $count = shift;
00215   return 1 if $self->context->flag("allowWrongArgCount");
00216   my $name = $self->{name};
00217   my $args = scalar(@{$self->{params}});
00218   if ($args == $count) {
00219     return 0 if ($count == 0 || $self->{params}->[0]->length > 0);
00220     $self->Error("Function '%s' requires a non-empty input list",$name);
00221   } elsif ($args < $count) {
00222     $self->Error("Function '%s' has too few inputs",$name);
00223   } else {
00224     $self->Error("Function '%s' has too many inputs",$name);
00225   }
00226   return 1;
00227 }
00228 
00229 #
00230 #  Find all the variables used in the arguments
00231 #
00232 sub getVariables {
00233   my $self = shift; my $vars = {};
00234   foreach my $x (@{$self->{params}}) {$vars = {%{$vars},%{$x->getVariables}}}
00235   return $vars;
00236 }
00237 
00238 ##################################################
00239 #
00240 #  Generate the different output formats
00241 #
00242 
00243 #
00244 #  Produce the string form.
00245 #
00246 #  Put parentheses around the funciton call if
00247 #    the function call is on the left of the parent operation
00248 #    and the precedence of the parent is higher than function call
00249 #    (e.g., powers, etc.)
00250 #
00251 sub string {
00252   my ($self,$precedence,$showparens,$position,$outerRight,$power) = @_;
00253   my $string; my $fn = $self->{equation}{context}{operators}{'fn'};
00254   my @pstr = (); my $fn_precedence = $fn->{precedence};
00255   $fn_precedence = $fn->{parenPrecedence} if $fn->{parenPrecedence};
00256   foreach my $x (@{$self->{params}}) {push(@pstr,$x->string)}
00257   $string = ($self->{def}{string} || $self->{name})."$power".'('.join(',',@pstr).')';
00258   $string = $self->addParens($string)
00259     if $showparens eq 'all' or $showparens eq 'extra' or
00260        (defined($precedence) and $precedence > $fn_precedence) or
00261        (defined($precedence) and $precedence == $fn_precedence and $showparens eq 'same');
00262   return $string;
00263 }
00264 
00265 #
00266 #  Produce the TeX form.
00267 #
00268 sub TeX {
00269   my ($self,$precedence,$showparens,$position,$outerRight,$power) = @_;
00270   my $TeX; my $fn = $self->{equation}{context}{operators}{'fn'};
00271   my @pstr = (); my $fn_precedence = $fn->{precedence};
00272   $fn_precedence = $fn->{parenPrecedence} if $fn->{parenPrecedence};
00273   $fn = $self->{def};
00274   my $name = '\mathop{\rm '.$self->{name}.'}';
00275   $name = $fn->{TeX} if defined($fn->{TeX});
00276   foreach my $x (@{$self->{params}}) {push(@pstr,$x->TeX)}
00277   if ($fn->{braceTeX}) {$TeX = $name.'{'.join(',',@pstr).'}'}
00278     else {$TeX = $name."$power".'\!\left('.join(',',@pstr).'\right)'}
00279   $TeX = '\left('.$TeX.'\right)'
00280     if $showparens eq 'all' or $showparens eq 'extra' or
00281        (defined($precedence) and $precedence > $fn_precedence) or
00282        (defined($precedence) and $precedence == $fn_precedence and $showparens eq 'same');
00283   return $TeX;
00284 }
00285 
00286 #
00287 #  Produce the perl form.
00288 #
00289 sub perl {
00290   my $self = shift; my $parens = shift;
00291   my $fn = $self->{def}; my @p = (); my $perl;
00292   foreach my $x (@{$self->{params}}) {push(@p,$x->perl)}
00293   if ($fn->{perl}) {$perl = $fn->{perl}.'('.join(',',@p).')'}
00294     else {$perl = 'Parser::Function->call('.join(',',"'$self->{name}'",@p).')'}
00295   $perl = '('.$perl.')' if $parens == 1;
00296   return $perl;
00297 }
